page.title: 03DEEPING ST JAMES SEWAGE WKS
page.content: The sewage treatment works serves Langtoft,Baston,and the Deeping St. James area.All the sewage is pumped to the sewage works from two pumping sta- tions at Broadgate Lane,Market Deeping and Towngate East. When it reaches the pumping station the sewage goes through a muncher that chops up any large pieces.It then goes to a big tank where it gets stirred up and then all the gravel settles out. The slurry then goes into deep primary sedimentation tanks which have scrapers that revolve very slowly and scrape off any fat.Then the liquids go to the filter beds.The Deepings works has one old circular filter bed and a more modern one.On these grows a green slim.The micro organisms in this slime feed on the proteins and carbohydrates in the sewage
